title: In your opinion, what are five of the happiest songs by The Doors? - Quora

response.answer_text: A song can be “happy” in many ways, so I've chosen five that personally make me happy for various reasons. (I've stuck with the albums featuring the original line up, so no Full Circle and Other Voices, also didn't consider the other albums with live readings and stuff that is closer to poems than songs.) Anyways, these are five of the happiest Doors songs in my opinion: Wintertime Love. I just LOVE this one. The lyrics are pretty wholesome for the Doors, it has a great tune and vibe. Ah, it's just so cute. Nothing to do with her sister “Summer's almost gone", that one is pure doom. Also, it's pretty hard for a song that says “la la la la” to not be happy.Roadhouse Blues. This one is just a banger. Maybe “uplifting” is a better way to describe it rather than “happy”, but it's no wonder that it is so popular. After that first “well keep your eyes on the road your hands upon the wheeaaal” it's just really hard to not be happy. Sure, as with pretty much all Doors songs the lyrics aren't all happy, “the future’s uncertain and the end is always near", but I see it more as a “let's enjoy this while it lasts even if it is not perfect” kind of thing. All of Morrison Hotel has a bit of that hard rock vibe we all love.Love street. Maybe the happiest Doors song for me if I had to choose. The music is so chill and calming and with the lyrics it just takes you somewhere else, a happy and cozy place where everything is alright. Seriously, this one gets me all warm inside.Spanish Caravan. Ok, I may be biased here because I am Spanish, but this one is great. That guitar intro and that calm vibe. And the lyrics “carry me caravan take me away, take me to Portugal take me to Spain…”, as Love Street this song takes me somewhere happy, but in Love Street it is a comfy sheltered place, while in this one it's a journey, searching for comfort in places you don't know but feel nostalgic about, (yeah call it wanderlust or whatever), wandering through life and enjoying the moment. It's just beautiful.Love me Two Times. Certainly the happiest song in Strange Days, and one of the happiest in general. No wonder this is another one of their greatest hits, sometimes a catchy classic rock love song is all you need to lift that spirit up.Of course these are just my interpretations of the songs, they could be awfully sad for other people, that's just how I like to see them. Give them a listen right now, you may discover some new songs or rediscover some old favorites. I've noticed three out of five songs are from Waiting for the Sun, so I guess that is the happiest album for me. Of course I left a lot out, but the Doors has songs for every feeling and mood even if some people thing most of their songs are on the depressing side, one of the greatest bands of all time.

Happy songs? Thing is, Ray Manzarek’s organ playing always sounded like a carnival to me - even when their lyrics went the other way. “Light My Fire”… “Roadhouse Blues”… “Hello I Love You”… “Touch Me”… “Love Me Two Times” (On second thought, I might walk this one back since I’ve reminded myself it’s about a soldier going off to Vietnam)… Maybe their tribute to Otis Redding “Runnin Blue”… Some seem happy except for a twist. “Moonlight Drive” almost made this list except I remember the closing lines as the song fades away “Get real close… get real tight… Baby gonna drown tonight going down down down…” Whoa. Or “Love Street” which sounds happy until he has the spoken passage in the middle and says “I guess I like it fine”. And then throws in a “So far” which makes it sound like less of a love song then you’d think. I suppose if I thought harder, I might re-do this list.
